851957707:
[

Graduate

Company Name Aon Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 280 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Launch your Career – Aon Graduate Program\xa0

Melbourne 2019 – Risk\xa0


Aon is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our colleagues work closely with our clients to develop solutions to some of their most complex challenges. If you want to have an impact, work with the best and be responsible for your potential – read on.


The opportunity\xa0


Our graduate program “Launch” is a 2-year springboard for your career. You’ll complete 4 rotations giving you exposure to different parts of our business and a permanent position on successful completion of the program. This ‘landing role’ is chosen to compliment the strengths you’ve demonstrated during the program and meet business needs.\xa0


The Launch program includes a structured development program, as well as on-the-job learning with technical training and opportunities to take on real business challenges. You’ll work collaboratively and build relationships across our organisation. You’ll have committed people leaders guide you through each rotation, a Grad buddy who’ll share experiences with you, as well as support from a business Sponsor.\xa0


As a leading provider of risk and people solutions, you will learn how we help clients anticipate and handle risks to their business through effective insurance, reinsurance and risk management solutions.\xa0


This graduate position will be our Risk function based in our Aon Melbourne office. There may be infrequent opportunities for travel which will be determined by your program rotations.\xa0


To view the full scope for the program, please visit http://www.aonearlycareers.com.au


Risk at Aon\xa0


Learn how we help clients anticipate and handle risks to their business through effective insurance, reinsurance and risk management solutions.


Who we’re looking for\xa0


At Aon, we're driven to empower economic and human possibility for clients, colleagues, and communities. We’re looking for people who are as excited about this mission as we are. Real, positive and well-rounded people who:


  • have work or intern experience (of any kind)
  • get involved in extracurricular activities
  • communicate with confidence, both verbally and in writing
  • show leadership characteristics and can build sound working relationships easilylearn quickly, as evidenced by strong academic results
  • have Australian citizenship or permanent residency

We are looking at a variety of academic backgrounds including but not limited to commerce, economics, business, law and arts.\xa0


To be eligible for the Aon graduate programme you must be completing your degree this academic year and be available to start on our programme in February 2019.\xa0


Due to the permanent nature of this role we can only accept applications who are a citizen of or hold permanent residency in Australia.


How to Apply

  • Make your mark and apply online today. Applications close on 16 September 2018.
  • Please only apply to your preferred position with the option to outline other programme preferences on the application page.

Aon is an equal opportunity employer and we invite you to be part of an organisation that has a diverse workplace, values continuous learning and supports many charities and environmental initiatives.

Job description

  • Do you enjoy a high-performing and encouraging environment?
  • Can you collaborate as a team to deliver the best customer experience?
  • Do you enjoy working in a diverse and inclusive team?



Please note: This role is a part time opportunity, working across the following roster;

Monday 9.30am – 2.30pm
Tuesday 10.30am – 2.30pm
Wednesday 9.30am – 4.00pm (30min break)
Thursday 9.30am – 2.30pm
Friday 9.30am – 2.30pm

At CommBank we never lose sight of the role we play in other people's financial wellbeing. Our goal is to help people and businesses move forward, to progress, to make the right financial decisions and achieve their dreams and aspirations.

What will you do?
Our Customer Service Representatives meet all of our customers' financial needs. They identify and understand the broader investment and lending needs and refer more complex banking enquiries to specialist team members.

You will contribute to a team culture that acts with integrity and accountability, placing the customer at the centre of every interaction

What will help you succeed?
You will be highly motivated, with the ability to work as part of a team and individually in a busy and structured environment.
Your dedication to the customer experience will be evident through your ability to achieve targets in providing financial solutions to each of our customer needs.
Previous banking or finance experience will be helpful but absolutely not essential.

Benefits

854633903:
[

Account Delivery Executive

Company Name Microsoft Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 18 hours ago Number of views 64 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Account Delivery Executive (ADE) is responsible for the overall end-to-end customer experience of our Enterprise Services customers, creating and maintaining deep long-term customer relationships, driving Enterprise Services revenue growth by identifying and developing strategic opportunities, and overseeing/supporting services delivered by Domain delivery teams. The ADE leads the Enterprise Services teams, serving as an escalation point for both the customer and our delivery teams. The ADE monitors key performance indicators to ensure a healthy and growing business within their assigned account(s). Embodying the One Microsoft spirit, the ADE teams with Sales and the Domain Delivery teams to execute a winning strategy with positive outcomes for customers, employees, and Microsoft. ADEs are deployed 1 ADE to 1 customer (1:1) in our largest accounts, and up to 1:15 in our breadth account space.

Responsibilities

Relationship Management - Develop a customer aligned Service Delivery Plan (SDP) to deliver our services focused around people, process and technology

PreSales Support - The ADE knows the customer goal/needs and can identify and qualify leads. They can assist Sellers and PLs with deal shaping, and review/approve deals before customer

Delivery Oversight - The ADE is accountable to the customer for successful delivery of solutions and services that drive business value. The ADE leads and oversees the Enterprise Services delivery teams.

Executive Reviews & Strategic Planning - The ADE attends and leads both internal, and customer meets. They focus on solution status and realized value, removing risks and blockers, and strategic planning.

Financial Management - The ADE is the Area’s person that’s on the ground ensuring the business is healthy and profitable.

Qualifications

Relationship Management - Single point of contact/accountability for service delivery relationship within a portfolio. Partner with Commercial Enterprise Services and Services sellers to develop and maintain a stakeholder map and plan

Take actions to achieve customer Conditions of Satisfaction (CoS) and quality Customer and Partner Experience (CPE). Present to executives with impact and influence. Demonstrate leadership in escalations and turnaround situations. Accepts differences in culture and is aware of communication styles and interaction patterns across cultures

Delivery Management - Lead and enable team behaviors that drive customer satisfaction, improve performance and drive innovation. Create a team environment where individuals feel valued, challenged and supported. Ensure healthy engagements and account financials, such as predictable revenues, forecasting, and delivery margin. Manage changes and take corrective actions to achieve engagement quality and success

Accelerate Transformation - Envision and evangelize the future state of transformation programs in line with the customer strategy. Develop and sustain cross-team relationships between Delivery and Support. Lead by example the cultural shift to customer obsession while maintaining financials

Sales and Business Development - Understand industry trends and identify opportunities in your accounts. Leverage accounts' existing relationships to identify Enterprise Services opportunities. Develop and align the business development strategy with the accounts’ Commercial Enterprise Services and Services Sellers. Partner with sellers to ensure investments in qualified leads and strategic opportunities

Education - Bachelor’s Degree (B.S./B.A.) in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Industry

  • Computer Hardware
  • Computer Software
  • Information Technology and Services

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Sales
  • Business Development

[

English Language Teacher

Company Name Navitas Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 12 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

English Language Teacher

Melbourne, Short Fixed-Term Contracts

\xa0

Navitas is a diversified global education provider that offers an extensive range of educational services for students and professionals including university programs, language training, workforce education and student recruitment. Navitas listed on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX) in 2004 and is now an S&P/ASX Top 100 Company, employing more than 5,500 staff globally. Navitas operates across three Divisions.

Hawthorn-Melbourne is part of the Navitas Group. Hawthorn-Melbourne is one of Australia’s oldest and largest English language centres and maintains a reputation as one of the country’s premier English schools based on the quality of its teaching, curriculum, support services and facilities. Hawthorn-Melbourne, part of University Partnerships Australasia division within Navitas, is seeking to recruit English Language Teachers.



Essential Skills & Experience

\xa0


Qualifications

\xa0

  • Minimum of a first degree and formally recognized TESOL teaching qualifications



Experience


  • EFL/ESL teaching experience in Australia or overseas



Skills


  • Demonstration of excellent teaching abilities which produce high quality outcomes for Hawthorn-Melbourne students through the application of:
  • constructive and culturally sensitive class management;
  • current TESOL theory and practice in the ESL/EFL classroom; and
  • knowledge of the student profile including learning styles.
  • (Assessment of this criterion will include classroom visit(s) by the Director of Studies or Senior Teacher.)


  • Understanding of the importance of, and willingness and ability to carry out, the administrative duties required of Hawthorn-Melbourne teaching staff to a high standard (e.g. monitoring of attendance, assessment:standardisation and moderation, testing and placement, course record-keeping).


  • Existing or potential positive contribution to the life of Hawthorn-Melbourne through the utilisation of other skills and knowledge (e.g. other language skills, flexibility, innovative ideas and assistance with tasks outside of the classroom, such as graduation and professional development).


  • Professionalism, which includes qualities such as teamwork, collegiality, information and resource sharing, and high standards of professional conduct.



Desirable

  • EAP / IELTS preparation teaching experience
  • Secondary school teaching experience (particularly maths &/or science)
  • DELTA / Masters degree in TESOL or equivalent
  • e-learning skills
  • Strong MS Office competencies, including Outlook, Word and Power Point

\xa0

\xa0

What we offer

\xa0

The Navitas Group offers outstanding opportunities within Australia and abroad, and is values driven and an equal opportunity employer.


Successful applicants will be subject to relevant pre-employment checks, which may include a National Police Check and/or a Working with Children Check. Only people who are eligible to work in Australia may apply for this position.

\xa0

To be considered for this position you will be required to submit your CV and a covering email/letter. A Position Description Statement (PDS) is attached.

\xa0

Enquiries and applications, should be forwarded to:

\xa0

teaching@hawthornenglish.vic.edu.au

\xa0

Applications close: 31 October 2018

851330864:
[

Program Manager, Family Law Services

Company Name Victoria Legal Aid Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 39 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Full time ongoing position
  • Salary commensurate with experience, range: $107,037 - $136,229 plus superannuation
  • Attractive employee benefits including salary packaging


About the role:
Victoria Legal Aid (VLA) plays a central role in the family law system, helping people to resolve their family disputes to achieve safe, workable and child-focused parenting and care arrangements. This senior role will lead and develop the Family Law Services program and manage teams of lawyers delivering parenting disputes and Independent Children's Lawyer services.

Reporting to the Associate Director Family Law, you will play a pivotal role in the design and provision of legal services for clients in family law parenting and property disputes including representing children as Independent Children's Lawyers. You will advise on strategy, policy and legal issues and lead initiatives regarding service design, work practices and professional legal education to ensure high quality responsive and proactive delivery of legal services. You will also oversee a team of legal staff based in Melbourne and other locations.

About you:
We are seeking an experienced and passionate people manager to lead and develop our Family Law Services program. You will have extensive experience in people management with the ability to guide and develop a team of dedicated and experienced lawyers and support staff. You will also have demonstrated your ability to identify emerging trends and develop and implement policies, systems and changes to improve service delivery in previous roles.

You will have high level communication and influencing skills which will be crucial in building collaborative relationships with key stakeholders across all levels. You will demonstrate a strong interest in the work of our organisation and want to contribute to our purpose of making a difference in the lives of our clients and the community by continually striving towards improving client services.

Employee benefits:
We offer attractive employment benefits including salary packaging (making part of your salary tax-free and increasing take-home pay), flexible working arrangements, family friendly policies and opportunities for professional development. The work is both challenging and rewarding and our staff are supported by experienced and capable managers as well as a range of internal departments and programs committed to staff safety and development. VLA has a friendly and inclusive culture of people working to make a difference in the lives of disadvantaged Victorians.

How to apply:
Submit a current resume and completed Candidate Application Form addressing the specified key selection criteria. Separate responses to all of the key selection criteria outlined in the position description are not required. You must complete the candidate application form to be considered for this role.

For further information review the attached position description or contact Gayathri Paramasivam, Associate Director Family Law on (03) 9269 0154.

Closing date for applications: 11.59pm Sunday 16 September 2018.

853631373:
[

Commercialisation Account Manager

Company Name CSIRO Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 83 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Utilise your networking skills and commercial acumen to create funding opportunities
  • Manage strategic account relationships with funding partners
  • Be a part of a key supporting function of CSIRO's strategic goal of being Australia's innovation catalyst


The Position

As the Commercialisation Account Manager for CSIRO’s Energy Business Unit, you will be responsible for identifying, building and managing strategic account relationships with funding partners; building new models for investor relations and funding sources for commercial transactions; and leveraging these relationships to optimise and increase funding available for the commercialisation of deep science which will contribute to the financial sustainability of CSIRO.


Your responsibilities will include:

  • Establishing and utilising networks with organisations that are appropriate relevant investors for CSIRO.
  • Leveraging these relationships to create additional funding opportunities for CSIRO in both commercialisation and technology incubation.
  • Building new models for investor relations and funding sources for commercial transactions.
  • Developing deep relationships within CSIRO to ensure contemporary and relevant knowledge of deep science, and demonstrate strong business acumen to identify relevant opportunities to source and utilise funding.


Location: Melbourne (Clayton), VIC preferred; other sites may be considered
Salary: AU $131K to AU $145K pa plus up to 15.4% superannuation
Tenure: Indefinite
Reference: 57848


To be successful you will need:

  • Tertiary qualifications such as a degree in Science or Engineering and post graduate business qualification and/or equivalent relevant experience.
  • Professional networks in the finance, venture capital, innovation and/or entrepreneurial community.
  • Knowledge and/or experience in operating principles of start-ups or small businesses.
  • Experience building deep relationships to deliver an organisational/commercial benefit.
  • The ability to work collaboratively across a large, complex organisation that delivers results and benefits to multiple areas of the organisation and/or enterprise wide.
  • Strong commercial/business savvy with established internal and external networks to create financial opportunities for a large, complex organisation.
  • The highest standards of ethical behaviour and integrity for yourself and your team, combined with an ability to manage conflict in a proactive and constructive manner and take ownership of outcomes.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, commercial judgment and demonstrated ability to build trust and maintain strong professional and collaborative working relationships across a wide range of disciplines.


Before you apply, please view the full position details and selection criteria here:\xa0

https://jobs.csiro.au/job/Various-Commercialisation-Account-Manager/502746100/


We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you.


We imagine. We collaborate. We innovate.\xa0At CSIRO, we do the extraordinary every day. We innovate for tomorrow and help improve today – for our customers, all Australians and the world. We do this by using science and technology to solve real issues. Diversity is the compass that navigates our innovation. We provide an inclusive workplace that respects, values and actively pursues the benefits of a diverse workforce.


How to apply:\xa0Please upload one document only containing both your CV/Resume and cover letter, ensuring you provide enough information relevant to the criteria as listed in the position description, to enable the selection panel to determine your suitability.


Applications close:\xa011:59pm AEST, Tuesday 18th September 2018
